org.jcvi.jillion.sam

Interface SamFileDataStore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, DataStore<SamRecord>

    public interface SamFileDataStore
extends DataStore<SamRecord>
    DataStore wrapper around a single SAM or BAM file.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    Since:
    5.2

    • Method Detail

      • fromFile

        static SamFileDataStore fromFile(File samOrBamFile)
                          throws IOException
        Create a new SamFileDataStore instance that will parse the given sam or bam encoded file. If there is an accompanying BAI file in the same directory named samFile.getName() + ".bai", then the index will be automatically detected and used by the Datastore to improve parsing runtime. All records in the file will be included in this datastore. If any filtering or non-standard indexes are required, please use SamFileDataStoreBuilder.
        API Note:
        this is the same as new SamFileDataStoreBuilder(samOrBamFile).build();
        Parameters:
        samFile - the sam or bam file to use; can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file does not exist or is not readable.
        NullPointerException - if samFile is null.
        Since:
        5.3
        See Also:
        SamFileDataStoreBuilder

      • get

        SamRecord get(String queryName)
       throws DataStoreException
        Get the first record with this query id that is in this datastore. This method should probably not be used since SAM and BAM files often have multiple SamRecords with the same queryName if there are multiple alignments or paired end data then the forward and reverse reads often have the same queryname.
        Specified by:
        get in interface DataStore<SamRecord>
        Parameters:
        queryName - the id of the object to fetch; may not be null.
        Returns:
        the object being fetched, will be null if contains(id) is false.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem fetching the data from this DataStore.
        See Also:
        getAllRecordsFor(String)

      • getAllRecordsFor

        List<SamRecord> getAllRecordsFor(String queryName)
                          throws DataStoreException
        Get all the SamRecords in this datastore that have the given queryName.
        Parameters:
        queryName - the SamRecord.getQueryName() to look for; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a List of all the SamRecords with that queryname; will never be null, but may be empty if there are no records in the datastore that match.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.

      • getHeader

        SamHeader getHeader()
             throws DataStoreException
        Get the SamHeader of this SAM or BAM file.
        Returns:
        the SamHeader will never be null.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.

      • getAlignedRecords

        StreamingIterator<SamRecord> getAlignedRecords(String referenceName)
                                        throws DataStoreException
        Get all the SamRecords that aligned to the given reference.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the reference to look for. This name should be in the SamHeader.getReferenceSequences().
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator of all the Records that align to the given reference.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.

      • forEachAlignedRecord

        <E extends Throwable> void forEachAlignedRecord(String referenceName,
                                                ThrowingConsumer<SamRecord,E> consumer)
                                         throws DataStoreException,
                                                E extends Throwable
        Get all the SamRecords that aligned to the given reference and for each one, call the given consumer's call back method.
        Implementation Note:
        this will probably be faster than using getAlignedRecords(String) since most iterator implementations use multiple blocking threads.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the reference to look for. This name should be in the SamHeader.getReferenceSequences(); can not be null.
        consuemr - a ThrowingConsumer instance that will be called for each aligned record. Can not be null.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
        E extends Throwable
        Since:
        5.3

      • forEachAlignedRecord

        <E extends Throwable> void forEachAlignedRecord(String referenceName,
                                                Range alignmentRange,
                                                ThrowingConsumer<SamRecord,E> consumer)
                                         throws DataStoreException,
                                                E extends Throwable
        Get all the SamRecords that aligned to the given reference and for each one, call the given consumer's call back method.
        Implementation Note:
        this will probably be faster than using getAlignedRecords(String, Range) since most iterator implementations use multiple blocking threads.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the reference to look for. This name should be in the SamHeader.getReferenceSequences(); can not be null.
        alignmentRange - the Range along this reference to find alignments for.; can not be null.
        consuemr - a ThrowingConsumer instance that will be called for each aligned record. Can not be null.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
        E extends Throwable
        Since:
        5.3

      • forEachAlignedRecord

        default <E extends Throwable> void forEachAlignedRecord(String referenceName,
                                                        Collection<Range> alignmentRanges,
                                                        ThrowingConsumer<SamRecord,E> consumer)
                                                 throws DataStoreException,
                                                        E extends Throwable
        Get all the SamRecords that aligned to the given reference within the alignment Ranges given. Only SamRecords that align to the reference AND the alignment INTERSECTS with at least one of these ranges will passed to the callback Consumer. Please note to match the output of samtools view if a record intersects multiple ranges given, then it will be returned multiple times.
        Implementation Note:
        this will probably be faster than using getAlignedRecords(String, Range) since most iterator implementations use multiple blocking threads.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the reference to look for. This name should be in the SamHeader.getReferenceSequences(); can not be null.
        alignmentRanges - the Ranges along this reference to find alignments for. Please Note: to keep compatibility with samtools, the same record could be returned multiple times if it intersects multiple ranges given; can not be null.
        consuemr - a ThrowingConsumer instance that will be called for each aligned record. Can not be null.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.
        NullPointerException - if any parameter is null.
        E extends Throwable
        Since:
        5.3

      • getAlignedRecords

        StreamingIterator<SamRecord> getAlignedRecords(String referenceName,
                                               Range alignmentRange)
                                        throws DataStoreException
        Get all the SamRecords that aligned to the given reference within the alignment Range given. Only SamRecords that align to the reference AND the alignment INTERSECTS with this range will be included in the returned Stream.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the reference to look for. This name should be in the SamHeader.getReferenceSequences().
        alignmentRange - the Range along this reference to find alignments for. The Range can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator of all the Records that align to the given reference inside the alignment range.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.

      • getAlignedRecords

        default StreamingIterator<SamRecord> getAlignedRecords(String referenceName,
                                                       Range... alignmentRanges)
                                                throws DataStoreException
        Get all the SamRecords that aligned to the given reference within the alignment Ranges given. Only SamRecords that align to the reference AND the alignment INTERSECTS with at least one of these ranges will be included in the returned Stream. Please note to match the output of samtools view if a record intersects multiple ranges given, then it will be returned multiple times.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the reference to look for. This name should be in the SamHeader.getReferenceSequences().
        alignmentRanges - the Ranges along this reference to find alignments for. Please Note: to keep compatibility with samtools, the same record could be returned multiple times if it intersects multiple ranges given.
        Returns:
        a new StreamingIterator of all the Records that align to the given reference inside the alignment range.
        Throws:
        DataStoreException - if there is a problem parsing the file or if the datastore is closed.
        Since:
        5.3
